member.name: T:SySal.Executables.OperaFeedback.MainForm
member.summary:
OperaFeedback interface. It can be used in two ways: 1) to insert new feedback into a scanning DB; 2) to download feedback information from a scanning DB.
In the first case, OperaFeedback should be used a follows the steps below:
Load a TSR file.
Type the id of the vertices that are relevant to vertex location feedback, then click "Add Vertex" for each of them.
Set the attributes for the vertices, by selecting each vertex, modifying the flags, and then clicking on "Set attributes".
Set the attributes for the tracks, by selecting each track, modifying the flags, and then clicking on "Set attributes".
If there are one-prong vertices, you need to add the related track by clicking on the "Add Track" button, with a meaningful id, and keeping the "1-prong" checkbox checked.
Add vertices detected manually.
Add tracks detected manually. Each track must either be connected to an existing vertex, or it is the only outgoing track of a single-prong vertex; in the latter case, check "1-prong".
Tracks/vertices can be selected also by clicking on the display. Apply any correction you need.
Select a machine to record data to the DB.
Select a program setting configuration to record data to the DB.
Select a valid brick number (including the leading "1000000").
Click on "Write to DB".
Please notice that the "author" of the feedback will be the OPERA Computing Infrastructure user currently logged on (see OperaDbGUILogin/OperaDbTextLogin and ).
In order to use OperaFeedback to view/check feedback information from the DB, take the following steps:
Select a valid brick number (including the leading "1000000").
Click on ">" to get the available feedback data sets.
Click on "Read from DB" to get the selected feedback data set.
